tool.name: BACKSUB
tool.description: Autofluorescence subtraction module for sequential immunofluorescene images.
tool.command:
@CMD_BEGIN@
##Supply images #for $i in $root: -r '$i' #end for
##Supply markers #for $i in $markers: -m '$i' #end for
##Name output image file #for $i in $output: -o '$i' #end for
##Name output markers file #for $i in $marker-output: -mo '$i' #end for
##Additional arguments #if $adv.pixel_size --pixel-size $adv.pixel_size #end if
#if $adv.tile_size --tile-size $adv.tile_size #end if
#if $adv.chunk_size --chunk-size $adv.chunk_size #end if

param.name: root
param.label: File path to root image file

param.name: markers
param.label: File path to required markers.csv file

param.name: chunk-size
param.label: Chunk size for dask array (e.g for chunksize 1000, the image will be split into 1000x1000 chunks) (default 5000)

tool.help:
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------- BACKSUB: BACKground SUBtraction for multichannel and multicycle images --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
**MCMICRO's Background autofluorescence subtraction for cyclic imaging data**
**BACKSUB** performs Pixel-by-pixel channel subtraction scaled by exposure times primarily developed for images produced by the COMET platform and to work within the MCMICRO pipeline. Main usecase is autuofluorescence subtraction for multichannel and multicycle images for visualization of images from tissues with high autofluroescence (FFPE), improved segmentation, and quantification (if the previous two usecases aren't necessary, downstream subtraction of autofluorescent signal is encouraged as the script is memory inefficent).
*Visit https://github.com/SchapiroLabor/Background_subtraction/ for the most up-to-date information on BACKSUB.*
